availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, educational institution founded by John Bryan Bowman and chartered by the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky. First housed in the former Bacon College building in Harrodsburg, from 1858 to 1864. Building destroyed by fire on February 16, 1864. Consolidation of Kentucky University and Transylvania University on February 28, 1865, created the Agricultural and Mechanical College of Kentucky, but the name of Kentucky University was retained until 1908.

ab.bibl:
Cone, Carl B, The University of Kentucky : A Pictorial History, (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1989), 3.
"Kentucky University " in The Kentucky Encyclopedia, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 515.
